Agile Express

  1. Express is completely open source and completely free. Project home page is: http://agileexpress.sourceforge.net . It has a very clean and easy to use web based UI written in Flex. It provides backlog management, iteration management, has a virtual wall, burndown charts and velocity comparison charts. (LinkedIn3)
  2. Try Agile Express http://sourceforge.net/projects/agileexpress. We've been using this for a while. (LinkedIn2)
  3. Have a look at Express Jan, http://agilexpress.sourceforge.net It allows you to configure a project so that it's stories measure effort in points, days, or hours. It supports multiple tasks per story that for which effort is measured in hours. It has a virtual wall in the scrum style with stories stationary on the left and tasks which move through swim-lanes. Of course it is open source and completely free. If you do try it out I would really appreciate some feedback on the project forums, the feedback I am getting is really helping to build and prioritise the product backlog. (LinkedIn2)
  4. As good as ScrumWorks but without the overheads of the fat java client ! (sourceforge.net)
